bwwExcerpt: If his full-throttle commitment to the concept of this audaciously reimagined Macbeth is any indication, a restful hiatus between seasons of The Good Wife was apparently not a priority for Alan Cumming. Staged as the obsessive fever dream of a schizoid patient in a psychiatric isolation unit, The National Theatre of Scotland production renders secondary the tragedy's political core drama of ambition and power. Instead it harnesses the text's mood of hallucinator
